封email就咁寫:
1. 印有申請編號之『收訖通知』副本 Copy of Acknowledgement of Application
2. 香港身份證副本 Copy of Hong Kong Identity Card
3. 公開考試證書副本（中學會考 / 中學文憑考試 / 高級程度會考）Copies of Public Exam Certificates (HKCEE / HKDSE Exam / HKALE)
4. 學士及其他學位之畢業證書副本 Copies of Certificates for Bachelor's Degree and Higher Degree(s)
123456d
5. 大學學業成績表正本 Official Transcripts for Bachelor's Degree and Higher Degree(s)#
6. 符合英語 能力規定的學歷／資格證明文件副本（詳情請參閱課程資料入學資格一欄）Copies of Proof on English Proficiency Requirement (Please visit Admission Requirements of PGDE Programmes information for details.)
7. 現職及以往工作證明文件副本 Copies of Current & Previous Employment Proof (e.g. contract stating the period of employment) (只適用於報讀二年兼讀制課程之申請人 For applicants applying for two-year Part-time programme only)
8. 請說明擬轉職教學工作之原因(不多於300字，中英均可) Please explain why you would like to become a teacher(只適用於報讀二年兼讀制課程(非全職教師) For applicants of two-year part-time (non-teaching) programme only)
9. 其他相關文件 (如適用) Other related documents, if applicable

Dear PGDE applicant,


Thank you for applying to our PGDE programme. This year we require all shortlisted English Language Education (ELE) applicants to upload a video* of NOT MORE than four minutes to address the question prompts below**. Only you should be present in the video. You must ensure your video is of a high audible and visual quality and that you speak in English and can be fully understood at all times. You must be visible as the person speaking all throughout the video – no proxy is allowed. Video submissions of more than four minutes will not be considered and your application will not progress further if yours is longer than the required length.


Please include the following in your video:

1. Briefly introduce yourself using your full name and say what you are looking forward to on the HKU PGDE (45 seconds).

2. Introduce one IT tool (not Kahoot) you could use in an English lesson and explain how and why it could be effective in terms of helping either primary or secondary age learners learn English. Also say how this tool might be used in face-to-face as well as online teaching and learning situations. (3 minutes 15 seconds)
